column5: Anyone ever fished in this area in early October? Just wondering if the fish are still feeding pretty well at this time. Thanks
Musky are big, angry, hungry and aggressive at that time of year.

The Indian Lake chain in October is even better than normal times, the fish are all up and it's your choice of fishing methods,casting or pulling cranks, jigs, rigs,quick strike rigs for musky, etc. and you'll have the chain to your self( except for me) . hardly a boat out there, because hunting season has started. In October you can get a Indian summer too, and the fall colors speak for themselves. Spring & fall are big fish times on the chain!!

The first two post are telling you lies, once the water cools down in the fall the fish also quite feeding so they can save all of their strength to make it through the long cold winter. You should probably try to schedule all of your fishing trips for the month of July and the first two weeks in August. Sorry, couldn't resist.

Thanks for the information on the fishing there. I think I will try it up there in October, although I like walleyedurans answer too, maybe I should just work longer hours at the office? That really sounds fun.
hey waldorf, Me thinks walleyeduran's nose is getting a little bit LONGER as we speak, if you see a cr√®me colored crestliner out there, that would be me!!
